paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant Val122Ile, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: 44% of Val122Ile carriers > 50 years old have heart failure (HF) or cardiomyopathy.
70% of Val122Ile carriers aged 70 years have heart failure.
100% of Val122Ile carriers aged 80 years have heart failure.
Some carriers may remain unaffected despite carrying the variant.

functional_data.summary: The Val122Ile variant leads to destabilization of the TTR protein, contributing to amyloid formation.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families, particularly among African American populations.
variants.population_frequency: Approximately 4% of African Americans carry the Val122Ile variant.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on penetrance studies and population frequency.
variants.additional_notes: The penetrance data suggests a significant age-dependent risk for developing heart failure among carriers.
key_quotes: The Val122Ile is the most common hATTR variant in the US and this mutation is present in approximately 4% of African Americans.
The exact penetrance is unknown, though some data evaluations estimate 44% of Val122Ile carriers > 50 years old have heart failure (HF) or cardiomyopathy.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR variant Val122Ile was extracted successfully.
